{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3269197,"name":"","username":"jagxas","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/f08c70/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-12-26T14:23:15.589Z","cooked":"

Is it possible? Or do we need “Through Bore Encoder” for our Neo’s 100%? We are currently building Swerve and need absolute encoders for rotation

Edit: Can we use SPARK MAX Data Port Breakout Board - REV Robotics SPARK MAX Data Port Breakout Board on SparkMaxes and connect SRX Mag Enc directly to this board

REV Robotics","clicks":9},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/srx-mag-encoder-with-neo-easiest-wiring-roborio-vs-spark-data-port/446946/4","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"SRX Mag Encoder with Neo : easiest wiring ...Roborio vs Spark data port","clicks":3},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-team-340-greater-rochester-robotics-2024-build-thread-open-alliance/443107/43","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"FRC Team 340 Greater Rochester Robotics | 2024 Build Thread | Open Alliance","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61222,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/srx-mag-encoder-with-neos/446885/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3269201,"name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-26T14:49:34.007Z","cooked":"

Yes it’s possible to wire an SRX mag encoder into a Spark Max. We did it for all of our arm joints last year. However it’s not really easy because the pinout from the encoder direct match the pinout from the Spark data port. You have to make an adapter cable or board, which can be tricky with the incredibly thin ribbon cable wires.

As I recall, Pin 9 on the encoder needs to go to pin 6 on the Spark Data port, as per the diagrams below. ( Rev’s “Absolute Encoder Adapter” board does this, but has a connector that is not compatible with the CTRE encoder).

SRX mag encoder spark pin diagram921×413 12.7 KB

Eaier to use the helium encoder from ReDux Robotics. It works just fine.

While I absolutely agree with robo5142 regarding the helium encoders, if you are set on using the CTRE Mag Encoders (especially if you already have them) then you might want to look at:
Encoder interface board
It is a simple passive board to make the pinout for the encoder and SpakMax line up.

You can also chain 2 gadgeteer breakout boards together to only connect the 5V, 3.3V (?) GND, and move Pin 9 to Pin 6.
